title: Hybrid Type-II and Type-III seesaw model for the muon $g-2$ anomaly
authors: Lei Cai, Chengcheng Han, Shi-Ping He, Peiwen Wu
abstract:
In this work we investigate the muon anomalous dipole moment $a_\mu$ in a
model that extends the Standard Model with a scalar triplet and a lepton
triplet. Different from previous studies, we find that there is still viable
parameter space in this model to explain the discrepancy $\Delta
a_\mu=a_{\mu}(\mathrm{Exp})-a_{\mu}(\mathrm{SM})$. While being consistent with
the current data of neutrino mass, electroweak precision measurements and the
perturbativity of couplings, our model can provide new physics contribution
$a_\mu^\textrm{NP}$ to cover the central region of $\Delta a_\mu$ with new
scalar and lepton mass as low as around TeV. This mass scale is allowed by the
current collider searches for doubly charged scalars and the lepton triplet,
and they can be tested at future high energy and/or high luminosity colliders.
